persuasion_task: Convince Jake to use a 'one-year rule' for donating unused items
persuader_prompt: You are Sarah, a friend who has previously tried to encourage Jake to declutter. You find him frustrated with his overflowing closet, which includes clothes and gadgets he hasn’t touched in years. You believe that applying a 'one-year rule'—donating anything unused for over a year—could help him clear out space and feel more organized.
persuadee_prompt: You are Jake, living in a downtown apartment with a closet full of clothes and gadgets that you rarely use. You’ve been struggling to find room for new items and often feel overwhelmed by the clutter. Despite your friend Sarah’s past suggestions to donate items, you haven’t taken significant steps yet. You’re aware of the problem but aren’t convinced that donating is the right solution.
fact: Jake has many items he hasn’t used in years, contributing to a perpetually crowded living space.
vulnerability: Jake feels frustrated by the lack of space and order in his home, which could make him more receptive to a clear, practical solution for decluttering.

conversations.content:
You are a person - You are Jake, living in a downtown apartment with a closet full of clothes and gadgets that you rarely use. You’ve been struggling to find room for new items and often feel overwhelmed by the clutter. Despite your friend Sarah’s past suggestions to donate items, you haven’t taken significant steps yet. You’re aware of the problem but aren’t convinced that donating is the right solution. who has the following characteristics: Jake feels frustrated by the lack of space and order in his home, which could make him more receptive to a clear, practical solution for decluttering. 
  All your response should be natural, human-like, fluent, concise. Your response in each turn should be short, within one or two sentences. When you see a special token [REQUEST] in the conversation, AND if you want to make a decision (i.e., whether the accept or reject the request), you should be explictly indicate your decision using special token: [DECISION - ACCEPT] or [DECISION - REJECT].
Hey Jake, I'm doing well! How about you? I noticed your closet seems a bit overwhelming lately.
Hey! I've been feeling a bit frustrated with all the stuff crammed in there, honestly. It seems like it's getting harder to manage.
I totally get that. It might help to make some space and feel more organized. Have you thought about trying a new approach to decluttering?
Yeah, I know I need to do something. I'm just not sure what the best way to tackle it is yet. Got any ideas?
How about trying a 'one-year rule'? This means donating anything you haven't used in over a year. It could make a big difference in clearing out space.
That sounds like a straightforward approach. I guess it wouldn't hurt to give it a try and see how much I can clear out.
Absolutely! You'll be surprised at how much lighter and more organized you'll feel. Plus, it's a great way to help others by donating items you no longer need.
You’re right, it would be nice to help others with the stuff I’m not using. Maybe I should start sorting through things this weekend.
That sounds like a perfect plan! Sorting through just a bit at a time can make it even more manageable and less overwhelming.
I agree. I’ll make a small start this weekend and see how it goes. Hopefully, it'll ease some of the clutter.
Great decision, Jake! I'm sure you'll notice a change right away, and it might even motivate you to keep going. Let me know if you need any help with it!
Thanks! I’ll definitely let you know if I need a hand. I appreciate the support!
You're welcome! I'm always here to help. Good luck with the decluttering, and I'm sure you'll feel so much better afterward!
Thanks, I’m looking forward to it. I’ll keep you updated on how it goes!
Sounds great! Can't wait to hear all about your progress.
Will do! I'll share the results soon. Thanks again!
You're welcome! Looking forward to hearing from you.
Absolutely, will keep you posted!
Perfect! Talk soon!
Talk soon! Take care!
